Node.definition: = process by which an action is repeated or continued
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= time of harvest in life, when man has gained maturity and wisdom
= intimate, close association with another person or deity or a group
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

Node.gloss: to take a bath|to bathe|to wash
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness
literally: step; hence, probably: = the part of the body used for walking

= coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into cheese (חָרִיץ) or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well
= hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

Node.gloss: to cause to flow > to yield
Node.definition: literally: to cause to flow; hence: = causative action by which a substance brings into existence a liquid ◄ as if it comes pouring from that substance
= a relatively large quantity of liquid flowing with strength

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
= place(s) where one or more persons are seated, primarily used for officials and dignitaries

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen by others; ► in order to be safe from danger or to attack someone else
= state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ often associated with wisdom and respectability
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

Node.gloss: to withhold|to prevent|to keep from|to stop from|to close
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities keep people or objects from activities that they are normally involved in
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
literally: to put (one's) hand on (one's) mouth; hence: = action by which humans intentionally refrain from speaking
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army

Node.gloss: (one's) voice hides > to refrain from speaking
Node.definition: literally: to hide oneself (of one's voice); hence: = action by which humans refrain from speaking
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body
= state in which an object is positioned around or against another object in such a way that the two cannot be separated easily
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= to communicate to someone else that you consider him/her or someone else fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of respect

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to testify|to bring a charge|to bear witness
Node.definition: = action with which a person gives evidence or proof of something, often as a witness in a legal setting ► the witness can be favorable or unfavorable
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: to clothe oneself; hence: = action by which humans are deities engage themselves in a certain activity
literally: to clothe oneself; hence: = action by which humans are deities engage themselves in a certain activity

= long garment, hanging down to the ankles, ◄ usually made of wool, ► and worn over the tunic (כֻּתֹּנֶת) it is not clear whether it had sleeves or not, nor whether it was open or closed in the front; ≈ certain attitudes and emotions are often described in terms of such a garment, e.g. he wore fury like a robe
= cloth wound around the head, ► used by both priests and ordinary people
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a person, ◄ compared to a father, ► who provides care for the people under his authority; ≈ often extended to refer to God
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
used in poetry only: = large, sharp teeth (שֵׁן) of an animal; ≈ associated with aggression
literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility
= action when people or objects stay overnight in a certain place
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= process by which an object appears in a certain location

Node.gloss: to be silent|to keep silent|to remain silent|to be silenced
Node.definition: = to refrain from speaking
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= rain that falls during the first half of April, before the harvest; ► provides the moisture that is crucial for the grains to mature; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH

= action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness
= state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or event, which means that this person is believed to be speaking the truth, or that this event is true

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
exact meaning unknown; literally: to let fall; hence: = state in which humans are unappreciative of something
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
literally: head; hence: = the person in leadership of a group of people, or, by extension, the most important object among a set of objects
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a group of armed humans equipped for fighting on land, whose main purpose it is to execute swift attacks and loot and plunder as much as they can; sometimes also used to denote a unit of a more regular army
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
